snippet: A new law to make lawmakers and state officials reveal their outside clients could be subverted by secrecy rules.
abstract: New York State Joint Commission on Public Ethics has raised concerns about possible legal loophole in disclosure requirements ready for enactment; Legislative Ethics Commission, which helps commission with ethics policing, has said proposed rule governing implementation of requirements could violate Public Officers Law, which requires formal request for outside client information.
lead_paragraph: A new law to make lawmakers and state officials reveal their outside clients could be subverted by secrecy rules.

headline.main: Albany Ethics Panel Fears Loophole May Limit Disclosure Requirements
headline.print_headline: Loophole Seen in Albany Disclosure Law
